definition: to sit and await success or failure (idiom); to wait to see the outcome of a fight before taking sides/to sit on the fence
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: He remained neutral on the surface, but Actually he was looking on coldly.
sentences.chinese: 他表面上保持中立，其实是在坐观成败。

sentences.english: But I can't just sit back and watch either.
sentences.chinese: 但我可做不到保皇小游戏坐观成败。

definition: (idiom) to hesitate/to remain undecided
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
to be defeated and dispersed
to send troops
see 苟且偷安[gou3 qie3 tou1 an1]
benefit from others' dispute (idiom)
elite soldiers, ample provisions (idiom); well-prepared forces/preparations for war are in an advanced state
(expr.) hold the feudal overlord and you control the whole country
pinyin: xie2 tian1 zi3 yi3 ling4 tian1 xia4

definition: to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
humble expression for generous donation
to wait for the opportune moment before taking action (idiom)
to dispatch an army/to send troops
seeking only ease and comfort (idiom); making no attempt to improve oneself/taking things easily without attending to responsibilities
lit. fish bone of a minister (idiom); fig. person one can rely on for candid criticism
